relevant_findings.cardiovascular_exam: Normal without murmurs; soft central systolic abdominal bruit radiating to both flank regions.
relevant_findings.MRA: Severe stenosis at the origin of the main left renal artery with a patent accessory renal artery.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Blood pressure was difficult to control with previous medications but improved with adjustment to atenolol, chlorthalidone, and felodipine.

relevant_findings.cardiovascular_exam: Exam findings indicate improvement in blood pressure control.
relevant_findings.MRA: One previous examination showed severe stenosis, but no intervention was performed.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: There has been overall improvement in blood pressure control with the new medication regimen.

relevant_findings.cardiovascular_exam: No new significant findings disturbed by the medication adjustments; blood tests revealed normal electrolyte and renal function.
relevant_findings.laboratory_tests: Normal complete blood cell count and electrolytes.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: With this regimen, subjective symptoms have improved and blood pressure has been reasonably well controlled.
